oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Barbara Mandrell - Part 1, 2 and 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Barbara Mandrell (performer) for Nashville's WSM. Tape labeled part 1, 2 and 3. Recording is from April 26, 1983.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Barbara Mandrell
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Barbara Mandrell performs a radio spot for Louise Mandrell's Diamonds, Gold and Platinum -- (00:40) Ralph Emery performs a radio spot for Louise Mandrell's Diamonds, Gold and Platinum -- (01:03) Mandrell gushes over Emery's expertise -- (01:42) Mandrell performs a radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (01:56) Mandrell performs a radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (02:14) Ralph Emery Show introduction tune [Featuring Ralph Emery voiceover] -- (02:31) Emery and Mandrell discuss Alabama and articles written about Mandrell -- (03:57) The expression of "In Times Like These" is discussed by Emery and Mandrell -- (05:46) Mandrell reflects on her road work with the Statler Brothers -- (07:47) Mandrell reflects on Louise Mandrell's professional career -- (11:28) Emery and Mandrell discuss Louise Mandrell's book and her experience on Emery's show -- (15:51) Mandrell discusses Gail Davies -- (16:22) Emery and Mandrell reflect on Louise Mandrell's book -- (19:10) Ralph Emery Show introduction tune [Featuring Ralph Emery radio spot voiceover] -- (20:24) Ralph Emery Show introduction tune [Featuring Ralph Emery and Mandrell voiceover] -- (21:07) Mandrell and Emery discuss how Mandrell was able to convince George Jones to perform on "I Was Country When Country Wasn't Cool" -- (24:19) Emery and Mandrell discuss the People's Choice Awards and Mandrell meeting Burt Reynolds -- (28:03) Mandrell jokes about Roy Acuff's response to the Do Rights -- (29:04) Emery and Mandrell reflect on Mandrell's desire to perform "Swing Low, Sweet Chariot" -- (33:13) Mandrell and Emery reflect on Mandrell's family performing with her -- (33:50) Charlie McCoy is discussed -- (34:38) Mandrell discusses her road show -- (35:23) Ralph Emery Show introduction tune [Featuring Barbara Mandrell radio spot voiceover] -- (36:36) Ralph Emery Show introduction tune [Featuring Ralph Emery and Barbara Mandrell radio spot voiceover] -- (36:55) Emery and Mandrell discuss Mandrell's work ethic -- (38:35) Mandrell's saxophone performance for "Til You're Gone" is discussed -- (39:10) Emery and Mandrell discuss the negative press she receives -- (42:43) Mandrell discusses her interactions with Wayne Newton with Emery -- (43:30) The Barbara Mandrell Fan Club is reflected on by Mandrell -- (45:14) Emery discusses a conversation he had with his wife about Mandrell's paternal exploits in New York -- (49:09) Emery reveals he had been to New York and Mandrell reflects on how recognizable she is -- (52:09) Ralph Emery Show introduction tune [Featuring Ralph Emery and Barbara Mandrell radio spot voiceover]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Mandrell, Barbara; Mandrell, Barbara, 1948-;
